1.name: Tim Messerschmidt
1.title: Developer Relations
1.shortBio: Tim Messerschmidt oversees Germany as Regional Lead for Google's Developer.
1.bio: Tim Messerschmidt oversees Germany as Regional Lead for Google's Developer Relations team. When not working with Android, he loves building backends with Node.js and researching user authentication concepts. Recently, Tim co-authored a book about identity concepts and data security. Before joining Google, Tim ran PayPal's Developer Relations team across EMEA and APAC.

2.name: Wolfram Rittmeyer
2.title: Android Developer
2.shortBio: Wolfram Rittmeyer is a passionate Android-Developer and loves to share his knowledge
2.bio: Wolfram Rittmeyer is a passionate Android-Developer and loves to share his knowledge. He has been writing articles about Android, is blogging on his blog Grokking Android, shares on Google+ and Twitter and talks about Android topics on devfests, user groups and conferences. Apart from Android he also has more than 15 years of experience with Java and JavaEE.

3.name: Christoph Reinartz
3.title: Front-End Developer  Teamlead UI/UX Engineering
3.shortBio: Front-End Developer & Teamlead UI/UX Engineering at trivago.
3.bio:
Front-End Developer Teamlead UI/UX Engineering at trivago. Christoph is working on scaling and improving the User Interface of the trivago products on a large scale since more than 4 years now. He worked in several agencies before.
 Christoph puts all his passion into making user interfaces and front-ends more consistent, accessible, performant and scalable. He likes an up-trending CSS specificity graph.

4.name: Filipe Mendes
4.title: Android Developer
4.shortBio: As an Android developer, I believe that every application should be as simple and as easy to use as possible.
4.bio: As an Android developer, I believe that every application should be as simple and as easy to use as possible. I am a freelancer, Sharednode.org founder, GDG organizer (Lisbon) and a former teacher of Java and Android courses in a media school. To add more, I am also, a Benfica supporter

5.name: André Diermann
5.title: Android Hacker
5.shortBio: André Diermann is an enthusiastic Android hacker with now more than 7 years of professional Android development.
5.bio: André Diermann is an enthusiastic Android hacker with now more than 7 years of professional experience in Android application development. As freelancer he worked for several companies and participated in international research projects. Today he and his team are engineering enterprise level mobile solutions for national and international companies. He is a strong Software Craftsmanship and Clean Code advocate with passion for Open Source.

6.name: Christoffer Noring
6.title: Google Developer Expert
6.shortBio: Google Developer Expert in web technologies and Angular. Organizing 5 meetup groups with more than 2000 members.
6.bio: Google Developer Expert in web technologies and Angular. Organizing 5 meetup groups with more than 2000 members. Frequent speaker, educator, blogger and developer.

7.name: Ivan Jukic
7.title: Android Developer at HRS
7.bio: Likes to discuss Android, UX, UI and new ideas. Also interested in photography, electric guitars, travelling and football

8.name: Phillip Richdale
8.shortBio: My name is Phillip Richdale and I am a consultant and a software architect.
8.bio: I’m a classic computer-kid of the 80ies and grew in parallel with the micro-computer revolution. For 31 years I’ve been programming and planing software and IT projects – since the turn of the millenium as my main occupation.

9.name: Nacho
9.shortBio: Nacho Coloma is Solution Engineer for Google Cloud Platform.
9.bio: Nacho Coloma is Solution Engineer for Google Cloud Platform. At Google he likes to help companies solve interesting problems while taking their systems to the cloud. For some reason excited about containers, storage and web technologies.!

10.name: Mario Bodemann
10.bio:
Google Developer Group Co-Organiser @Berlindroid
 Android and Java Evangelist @Contentful
 Software Engineer @Memorado and @HERE
 Graduate Software Engineer @Wooga
 Research Associate @HHIFraunhofer

11.name: Alex
11.shortBio: Alex is interested in a wide array of things. That's why he wants to create something completely new to share knowledge.
11.bio: Alex started his career as a developer in 1982 when he wrote a program for prime numbers on his commodore vc20. In the following 30 years of doing completely different things he had still been interested in computer development, observing things –and people- changing with computer progression and evolution. He popped up at the GDG Dusseldorf in August with a flash talk about a novel way to share knowledge.

12.name: Dylan Drost
12.title: App developer
12.shortBio: Android dev for five years - currently working on health care applications.
12.bio: Android Developer for 5 years now. I work at Karify where we are building an online healthcare platform to help treat and manage patients in Mental healthcare. I work on the Android app and helped build the REST Api for the platform. Before I joined Karify I worked at an agency on different large and small App projects. Beside making awesome Apps I help manage the technical part of the food blog Betty’s Kitchen which is run by my wife

13.name: Malte Lantin
13.title: Technical Evangelist
13.shortBio: Malte Lantin lives in the beautiful Ruhr area of Germany and works at the Developer Experience group at Microsoft Germany.
13.bio: He currently focuses on web technologies and the cloud. He loves exploring new technologies and discussing trends in the IT industry.

14.name: Benedikt Terhechte
14.title: Full stack developer
14.shortBio: I'm a full stack developer, experienced in delivering fully functional project prototypes.
14.bio: I'm a full stack developer, experienced in delivering fully functional project prototypes. This means the creation of desktop or mobile apps, web apps or backend services for startups or enterprise customers, to quickly get started on a project, win a pitch, or raise VC money

15.name: Ralf Wondratschek
15.shortBio: Ralf Wondratschek is a Sr. Software Engineer, Android on the Evernote product team.
15.bio:
Ralf works on the core Evernote client with a special focus on software architecture, the camera and third party app integration. He also maintains several open-source projects on Github like the Evernote Android SDK and the job library for Android.
 Prior to Evernote, Ralf worked together with several companies in Germany and published as independent developer three apps in the Google Play Store.ing soon!

16.name: Oleh Zasadnyy
16.title: Software engineer / Organizer
16.shortBio: Oleh is a front-end developer who is passionate by new technologies and design.
16.bio: Oleh is a front-end developer who is passionate by new technologies and design. He also is a GDG Lviv organizer last 5 years, which is famous for their high-level organized conferences. Besides that, he participates in GDG design competitions and always in the top three. Oleh has created several front-end Open Source projects. The most popular are event website templates, one of them you are looking at.

17.name: Jean-Baptiste Clion
17.title: Google Develeoper Expert Cloud
17.shortBio: Jean-Baptiste Clion (AKA JB) is a senior cloud engineer working with Google Technologies since 2007.
17.bio: Jean-Baptiste Clion (AKA JB) is a senior cloud engineer working with Google Technologies since 2007. He is the founder and co-organiser of GDG Basel, Switzerland. Jean-Baptiste worked in various industries such as Defence & Aeronautics, Finance & Consulting. In his last position, JB was Google Practice Lead at Capgemini Switzerland, he is now co-founding a startup dedicated to Progressive Web Apps solutions relying on cloud technologies.

18.name: Ulrich Hölscher
18.title: Systems Engineer
18.shortBio: Organizing 5 meetup groups with more than 2000 members. Frequent speaker, educator, blogger and developer.
18.bio: Ulrich Hölscher is a Systems Engineer with Dell EMC. In his work he’s focusing on software defined solutions and how to integrate new   He’s organizing and hosting the Everything as Code Meetup and Youtube channel.

19.name: David Cifuentes
19.title: GDE Google Cloud Services
19.shortBio: David is a GDE, Google Developer Expert, for Google Cloud products.
19.bio: David has a bachelor degree in software engineering and a masters degree in engineering at Universidad de los Andes. For the past few years, he's been developing and deploying enterprise software and mobile games on cloud computing platforms. He is also a certified Scrum Master and Scrum Developer, and passionate about agile methodologies. David is the founder and lead organiser of the GDG Bogotá - a Google Developers Group in his hometown. In his spare time he enjoys travelling the world and biking or trail running in the mountains.

20.name: Frederic Hemberger
20.shortBio: Frederic is a JavaScript freelancer from Cologne. During the last couple of years, ...
20.bio: he became interested in web-security and since then tries to rise awareness how developers can deal with the elephant in the room.
